page.title: 14Old Railway,Wolverhampton
page.content: A white stony pathway runs Where a railway line used to be. There are no more rumbles, No steam train clatters Over the meccano bridge. Birds twitter,sing,nest and fly In the clean air, Where once the steam locomotive Choked out clouds of smoke. White nettle,cow parsley and dandelions Now grow unsinged by the flying sparks. Healthy people now walk lean dogs, And fit joggers jog, Where once injured wartime soldiers, Lying on canvas stretchers, Were brought to hospital by train. Rustic tables and benches await the arrival of hungry picnickers Nearby chestnut horses are grazing on the lush green grass Their flaxen manes ruffled by the breeze.
